title.narrative: Lesotho (le): Aide ciblée aux pays
Lesotho: Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

Les conditions sont détaillées dans le cadre d'engagement des partenaires

title.narrative: WHO : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)
ICC/HSCC tracks implementation of annual workplan (% execution of activities and budgets) and provides oversight to course correction measures

target.value: Engage the existing community structures to help identify children never received vaccines (Zero doses children) and minimazing missed opportunities during routine immunization

comment.narrative: 2021 EPI annual workplan implementation affected by covid vaccinations and focus of ICC meeting has been on covid vaccinations and this has affected oversight on routine vaccines

target.value: Provide normative guidance to prepare for MR supplemementary activities and HPV reintroduction through the following outputs: Development/adaptation of tools(training, supervision,), guide on severice delivery strategies, post campaign coverage survey for MR campaign and post introduction evaluation for HPV reintroduction

comment.narrative: Delayed implementation of preparatory activities due to covid response vaccinations. However, adaptation/development of HPVV reintroduction tools has been initiated. On the other hand, MR campaign activities still at "0" stage and country waiting for disbursement of funds for these activities.

title.narrative: Annual workplan and budgets include interventions to reach zero dose children

target.value: Provide normative guidance to prepare for MR supplemementary activities and HPV reintroduction through the following outputs: Development/adaptation of tools(training, supervision,), guide on severice delivery strategies, post campaign coverage survey for MR campaign and post introduction evaluation for HPV reintroduction

comment.narrative: Both HPVV reintroduction and and MR campaign planned for February and April 2022 respectively. Already existing TWGs used to plan for covid vaccinations will be used. However, there will be need to clarify roles in the context of HPVV and MR campaigns. The country is also awaiting disbursement of funds to facilitate initiation of activities

target.value: Provide normative guidance to prepare for MR supplemementary activities and HPV reintroduction through the following outputs: Development/adaptation of tools(training, supervision,), guide on severice delivery strategies, post campaign coverage survey for MR campaign and post introduction evaluation for HPV reintroduction

comment.narrative: Delayed implementation of preparatory activities due to covid response vaccinations. However, adaptation/development of HPVV reintroduction tools has been initiated. On the other hand, MR campaign activities still at "0" stage and country waiting for disbursement of funds for these activities.

title.narrative: Performance management system in place

target.value: Engage the existing community structures to help identify children never received vaccines (Zero doses children) and minimazing missed opportunities during routine immunization

comment.narrative: District review with health facilities conducted in one district (Mafeteng) and the next district to be reviewed is Leribe. Each health facility had opportunity to share their data and it was found that negative drop out was common. as high as 25%. There is under utilisation of microplanning tools which should indicate the number of children by village. Large numbers of children missed their vaccine doses for for DTP3 and measles containing vaccine during the year 2020. Mitigation measures included registration of all children with indication of immunization status and putting in place to implement catch up vaccinations

title.narrative: WHO : Service Delivery
Service delivery related barriers of missed communities to access immunisation services identified and prioritized

target.value: Support implementation of the reaching every Community (REC) in focused districts to reach the zero-dose children for DTP, measles and polio vaccine, develop guidelines and tools to faciltate capturing of children with zero-doses for vaccines

comment.narrative: Activity affected by covid response activities and not much attention on continuity of essential services

title.narrative: Roadmap for improved integration of EPI with other PHC services

target.value: Support implementation of the reaching every Community (REC) in focused districts to reach the zero-dose children for DTP, measles and polio vaccine, develop guidelines and tools to faciltate capturing of children with zero-doses for vaccines

comment.narrative: District review with health facilities conducted in one district (Mafeteng) and the next district to be reviewed is Leribe. Each health facility had opportunity to share their data and it was found that negative drop out was common. as high as 25%. Challenges There is under utilisation of microplanning tools which should indicate the number of children by village. Large numbers of children missed their vaccine doses for for DTP3 and measles containing vaccine during the year 2020. Mitigation measures include registration of all children with indication of immunization status and putting in place to implement catch up vaccination

target.value: Support implementation of the reaching every Community (REC) in focused districts to reach the zero-dose children for DTP, measles and polio vaccine, develop guidelines and tools to faciltate capturing of children with zero-doses for vaccines

comment.narrative: Major delay due to covid response mainly focusing on vaccinations

title.narrative: health facility microplans up to date and used to strengthen implemenrtation of RED strategy in the country with focus on priritised districts

target.value: Provide technical support to strengthen implementation of the reaching every Community (REC) in all districts in collaboration with the Ministry and other EPI partners with focus on districts with low MCV1 and 2

comment.narrative: Health facility microplans reviewed and updated for 293 health facilities providing immunization in Lesotho. The challenge is financial resources to implement these plans with focus to districts with coverage for MCV1 and 2

comment.narrative: NITAG members participated in the regional webinars on covid vaccine as the country was preparing to introduce covid vaccines literature review on available covid vaccines conducted. Recommendations made to the Ministry to facilitate introduction of covid vaccines

title.narrative: EPI Policy in place in all health facilities that provide immunizations

target.value: Support provided to print and dissemination of updated National EPI policy to standardise policy practice for both public and private sector

comment.narrative: EPI Policy document reviewed and validated. However awaiting endorsement by relevant MoH authorities. This activity was supposed to have been completed during the first quarter of the year but delayed due to covid response activities

target.value: Support provided to print and dissemination of updated National EPI policy to standardise policy practice for both public and private sector

comment.narrative: Policy reviewed with districts and is due for printing. There has been minor delays as the focus was on covid response

title.narrative: Health workers in all facilities trained on AEFI surveillance Regalar reporting of AEFI cases from the field, linelist of all cases available and shared , Causality assessments conducted

target.value: Provide technical supprt to the Ministry to strengthen implementation of adverse events following immunzation activities

comment.narrative: Refresher training conducted for nine members of National AEFI committee leveraging on preparations for covid vaccinations Linelisting forms shared with health workers to facilitate reporting of AEFI cases Committee now functional and has been instrumental in the causality assessment of few severe AEFI cases following covid vaccination with AstraZeneca Health centre nurses from the 10 districts trained on AEFI, again leveraging on covid vaccination preparations

title.narrative: Clinton Health Access Initiative : Supply Chain & Procurement
20% of health facilities oriented by EPI CHOs/PHN on vaccine supply chain using e-learning material

target.value: Development of supply chain e-learning materials as per the supply chain SOPs for self-learning of EPI Child Health Officers and Public Health Nurses

comment.narrative: The activity had to be delayed to next year as the country's focus was on the COVID-19 vaccine introduction and roll-out. This has resulted in focus, capacity, and resources at the national and district being diverted to focusing on the vaccine roll-out as part of the nation's response to the COVID-19 pandemic. CHAI staff also placed focus on supporting MoH in the vaccine roll-out which among others included NDVP drafting and costing, continuous supportive supervision and oversight, everyday tracking of the COVID-19 vaccine consumption at all levels to ensure that vaccines are kept in the right conditions, vaccine batches that are due to expire are fully utilized, and vaccine redeployment from low volume sites to high volume sights, among others.

target.value: Development of supply chain e-learning materials as per the supply chain SOPs for self-learning of EPI Child Health Officers and Public Health Nurses

CHAI staff also placed focus on supporting MoH in the vaccine roll-out which among others included NDVP drafting and costing, continuous supportive supervision and oversight, everyday tracking of the COVID-19 vaccine consumption at all levels to ensure that vaccines are kept in the right conditions, vaccine batches that are due to expire are fully utilized, and vaccine redeployment from low volume sites to high volume sights, among others.

CHAI staff also placed focus on supporting MoH in the vaccine roll-out which among others included NDVP drafting and costing, continuous supportive supervision and oversight, everyday tracking of the COVID-19 vaccine consumption at all levels to ensure that vaccines are kept in the right conditions, vaccine batches that are due to expire are fully utilized, and vaccine redeployment from low volume sites to high volume sights, among others.

title.narrative: 1 annual audit conducted

target.value: Institutionalize annual audits of the vaccine supply chain

comment.narrative: The activity had to be delayed to next year as the country's focus was on the COVID-19 vaccine introduction and roll-out. This has resulted in focus, capacity, and resources at the national and district being diverted to focusing on the vaccine roll-out as part of the nation's response to the COVID-19 pandemic. CHAI staff also placed focus on supporting MoH in the vaccine roll-out which among others included NDVP drafting and costing, continuous supportive supervision and oversight, everyday tracking of the COVID-19 vaccine consumption at all levels to ensure that vaccines are kept in the right conditions, vaccine batches that are due to expire are fully utilized, and vaccine redeployment from low volume sites to high volume sights, among others.

title.narrative: 100% budget available for annual procurement of MR and BCG

target.value: Development of business case to secure funding for annual procurements of the MR and BCG vaccine antigens

comment.narrative: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the country had to reallocate resources for the emergency response and provision of social safety nets for citizens that were gravely affected by the pandemic and resulting national wide lock downs. The response thus put a strain on the country's fiscus which thus resulted in the challenge of allocating budgets for single annual procurements of health commodities.

target.value: Development of business case to secure funding for annual procurements of the MR and BCG vaccine antigens
Development of business case to secure funding for annual procurements of the MR and BCG vaccine antigens

title.narrative: UNICEF
The process and experiences of the sub-national/targeted approaches documented and shared with all partners.

target.value: To be further defined

comment.narrative: Activity not yet reviewed

title.narrative: Health workers and other relevant personel involved in EPI services trained on SBCC approaches including demand creation activities and use of approaches such as SMS reminders and surveys to track response

target.value: Support roll-out and implementation of communication strategy/ plans (including training of relevant staff)

comment.narrative: Immunization-specific training activity has been affected by Covid19. However messaging on continuity of immunization services has been integrated in the overall COVID-19 pandemic response risk communication and community engagement (RCCE) plans, with teams (including health and other frontline workers) trained in all 10 districts.

title.narrative: All health facilities are using new 30DTR devices

target.value: Provide technical support in systematic temperature monitoring of refrigerators and analysis using the 30DTR devises

comment.narrative: Installation of Fridge tag 2E has just been installed in the health facilities and it is ongoing in others.

title.narrative: IPC training package for health workers is available with report

target.value: Provide technical support for the development and roll-out of an IPC curriculum for health workers

comment.narrative: The activity has been affected by Covid-19 pandemic response. TOR has been developed and consultant to be recruited with the activity training scheduled for August 2021

title.narrative: At least one health worker from HFs in 5 districts trained on EVM SOPs

target.value: Provide technical support for implementation of EVMA findings and training on immunization supply chain management

title.narrative: WHO : Data
Data Improvement Plan (DIP) developed

target.value: Conduct national and district EPI reviews, support use of integrated supportive supervision (ISS) at district and health facility level, conduct quarterly new vaccine surveillance review

comment.narrative: District review with health facilities conducted in one district (Mafeteng) and the next district to be reviewed is Leribe. Each health facility had opportunity to share their data and it was found that negative drop out was common. as high as 25%. There is under utilisation of microplanning tools which should indicate the number of children by village. Large numbers of children missed their vaccine doses for for DTP3 and measles containing vaccine during the year 2020. Mitigation measures included registration of all children with indication of immunization status, defaulter tracking and putting in place plans to implement catch up vaccination and

target.value: Conduct national and district EPI reviews, support use of integrated supportive supervision (ISS) at district and health facility level, conduct quarterly new vaccine surveillance review

comment.narrative: EPI reviews conducted in 2 districts with 66 health care workers participating in the activity. Other planned supportive supervision activities affected by covid response activities especially vaccinations

title.narrative: Data Improvement Plan (DIP) implemented

target.value: Conduct national and district EPI reviews, support use of integrated supportive supervision (ISS) at district and health facility level, conduct quarterly new vaccine surveillance review

comment.narrative: This activity has not been carried out as planned. Most part of the time was dedicated to covid vaccinations. However, quarterly review meetings conducted in 2 districts and Sixty six (66) health care workers participated in the review of health facilities and districts performance for health facilities for Mafeteng and Leribe including members of the district health management teams. Included were senior officers based at DHMT who are charged with responsibility to support execution of primary health care services at the health centres; notably, district public health nurse, district health information officer, non-communicable disease nurse, SRH mentor, HR Officer, district surveillance officer. Pending is implementation of recommendations from the mentioned district reviews

title.narrative: WHO : Health Information Systems (Data)
Vaccine preventable disease cases are identified and reported to inform immunization program planning, implementation, monitoring, and risk mitigation

target.value: Provide technical support to the Ministry to conduct supportive supervision to districts and health facility level

comment.narrative: With covid -19 outbreak, essential services including EPI were disrupted. However the Ministry was supported to conduct integrated supportive supervision in 2 districts: Mafeteng and Leribe (14 health centres visited). The following assessments done: Knowledge, skills and best practice among health workers On job training and mentoring done Active case search for acute flaccid paralysis (AFP) and measles done Challenges: With introduction of covid vaccine in the country, EPI activities continued to be affected as the focus was directed to covid vaccination activities.

target.value: Provide technical support to the Ministry to conduct supportive supervision to districts and health facility level

comment.narrative: With covid -19 outbreak, essential services including EPI were disrupted. However the Ministry was supported to conduct integrated supportive supervision in 2 districts: Mafeteng and Leribe (14 health centres visited). The following assessments done: Knowledge, skills and best practice among health workers On job training and mentoring done Active case search for acute flaccid paralysis (AFP) and measles done Challenges: With introduction of covid vaccine in the country, EPI activities continued to be affected as the focus was directed to covid vaccination activities.

title.narrative: Clinton Health Access Initiative : Health Information Systems (Data)
Indicator reference guide validated 2 quarterly meetings held by the working groups at the district and national level 10 EPI CHOs/PHNs oriented on vaccine supply chain using e-learning material

target.value: Development of an indicator reference guide

comment.narrative: Indicator reference guide has been developed and awaiting validation by the EPI TWG.

title.narrative: 5 districts mentored in the data management SOPs 2 quarterly meetings held by the working groups at the district and national level 10 EPI CHOs/PHNs oriented on vaccine supply chain using e-learning material

target.value: Development of data management SOPs

comment.narrative: The data management SOPs have been developed however there have been challenges of effective mentorship. The country's focus has been on the COVID-19 vaccine introduction and roll-out. This has resulted in focus, capacity, and resources at the national and district being diverted to focusing on the vaccine roll-out as part of the nation's response to the COVID-19 pandemic. CHAI staff also placed focus on supporting MoH in the vaccine roll-out which among others included NDVP drafting and costing, continuous supportive supervision and oversight, everyday tracking of the COVID-19 vaccine consumption at all levels to ensure that vaccines are kept in the right conditions, vaccine batches that are due to expire are fully utilized, and vaccine redeployment from low volume sites to high volume sights, among others.

title.narrative: Check list validated and operationalized

target.value: Development of a vaccine supply chain audit check list and standard operating procedures

comment.narrative: The vaccine supply chain audit check list and standard operating procedures have been developed and reviewed internally by CHAI and the UNICEF regional office. The UNICEF regional office will be supporting with conducting the vaccine supply chain audit. The checklist has been modelled on the vaccine supply maturity model assessment, and adapted to country context. The validation of the check list and SOPs is targeted for 2022.

target.value: Development of a vaccine supply chain audit check list and standard operating procedures
Development of a vaccine supply chain audit check list and standard operating procedures

title.narrative: Clinton Health Access Initiative : Vaccine-Specific Support
NVI working groups established/strengthened in all 10 districts 10 EPI CHOs/PHNs oriented on vaccine supply chain using e-learning material

target.value: Support establishment of district level New Vaccine Introduction Working Groups

comment.narrative: The District Immunization Steering Committees (DISCs) have been established in all 10 districts. All 10 districts have had 3 to 4 meetings of the DISC. CHAI leveraged on the emergency created by the COVID-19 vaccine roll-out to expediate implementation of the activity among other competing priorities presented by the COVID-19 pandemic and the vaccine introduction. The next meetings will be held in January 2022, paving the way for the HPV vaccine reintroduction.

title.narrative: HPV vaccine educational materials developed and piloted in 3 districts 2 quarterly meetings held by the working groups at the district and national level 10 EPI CHOs/PHNs oriented on vaccine supply chain using e-learning material

target.value: Support coordination of HPV vaccine programme stakeholders at the national level and development of HPV vaccine programme education packages for the Ministry of Education, Ministry of Local Government and Chieftainship, and Ministry of Gender, Sports and Youth

comment.narrative: The HPV vaccine programme education packages are currently under development. The materials have been adapted by the HPV vaccine reintroduction training team on 25th to 26th November, and will be finalized once approved by the EPI TWG. Due to the focus and urgency created by the COVID-19 vaccine roll-out, a decision was undertaken by the Ministry of Health to postpone the vaccine reintroduction from January 2022 to the latter part of Q1 2022.

HPV vaccine educational materials developed and piloted in 3 districts
2 quarterly meetings held by the working groups at the district and national level
10 EPI CHOs/PHNs oriented on vaccine supply chain using e-learning material
